FuncDef: The display cpu-defend protocol-group queue configuration command displays the weight of the packets to be sent to the CPU in queues of certain protocol group.
CLIs: display cpu-defend protocol-group whitelist queue { whitelist-bgp | whitelist-ldp | whitelist-management | whitelist-multicast | whitelist-reserve } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group system-message queue system-message configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group access-user queue { bas-arp | bas-igmp | bas-nd | bas-trigger | dhcp | dhcpv6 | eapol | l2tp | lldp | ppp | vbas-reserve | web } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group link-layer queue { 3ah | bfd | link-detect | trunk | y1731 | interface-rdi | lag-check | lag-ping-trace | mac-vlan } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group arp queue { arp | nd } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group blacklist queue blacklist configuration slot <slot-id>

display cpu-defend protocol-group user-defined-flow queue { user-define-flow-1 | user-define-flow-2 | user-define-flow-3 | user-define-flow-4 | user-define-flow-5 | user-define-flow-6 | user-define-flow-7 | user-define-flow-8 } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group management queue { dcn | ftp | ntp | snmp | ssh | sshv6 | syslog | telnet } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group multicast queue { igmp | multicast-reserve | msdp | pim } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group mpls queue { ldp | oam-ping | rsvp | vxlan } configuration slot <slot-id>

display cpu-defend protocol-group network-layer queue { clock | default | dns | fragment | gre | hwtacas | icmp | icmpv6 | ipv4-reserve | ipv6-option | nhrp | vrrp | radius-diameter } configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group check-failed queue check-failed configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group fwddata-to-cp queue forward-data configuration slot <slot-id>
display cpu-defend protocol-group route-protocol queue { bgp | bgpv6 | isis | ospf | ospfv3 | rip } configuration slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 31  case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display cpu-defend protocol-group whitelist queue whitelist-bgp configuration slot 1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To query the weight of the packets to be sent to the CPU in queues of certain protocol group for analysis on the packets exceeding the specification, run the display cpu-defend protocol-group queue configuration command.
